reviewText: Excellant DVD that covers many counties of Ireland-a must see prior to visiting this gorgeous land-Rick Steves' is an excellant host and I most likely will purchase other videos in this series

I bought this DVD because it included the places I visited in 2006 -- the West Country of Ireland. As always, Steves makes everything both interesting and enjoyable -- and gives good advice in the process. Even if you can't actually go 'cross the pond... well, it's not quite as good -- but maybe it will hold you until you can get on that plane.  Oh, and be sure to watch the out-takes during the credits.  I hope Rick Steves is as nice as he comes across in his shows!  Bon voyage!
Beautiful countries and Rick Steves makes it look like an easy trip.  I would have liked a little more specific information on places to stay at each location.
I have been to Ireland and all over Scotland on many trips.  This DVD provides a pretty fair representation of both.  I would indeed recommend it to friend and family.
Rick Steves travel DVDs are such a pleasure to watch and enjoy. This DVD of Ireland and Scotland is especially wonderful and the scenery is magnificent.

Has there ever been another travel guide more amiable, more informative, more eclectic and just plain likeable than Rick Steves?  This somewhat nerdish but pleasant looking fellow will immediately win the viewer over with his charm, humor and smoothing, layback manner. However what will keep you watching program after program is his consummate knowledge of the sites and people he visits.

While each journey is only 30 minutes in length Rick has a unique talent of synthesizing the many facets that make up a people and place. He leaves no stone unturned in his analysis; historical background, spiritual heritage, cultural underpinnings and political legacy are all equally touched upon to give the audience a fuller understanding of the rural and urban landscape.

However not not an individual to dwell too much on the past, he provides a delightful tour of the markets, music, restaurants and nightlife. The kind of information would really want to know if you're out for a good time.

The production values are also wonderful offering fanstastic visuals that are worth watching even if there where no commentary. Traveling with Rick Steves' is the next best thing to being there.

This particular DVD contains six episodes, thirty minutes in length. Imagine three hours in Ireland and Scotland await, better get started!
I love seeing what to expect when I get there!  For that this DVD is perfect.
Rick Steves is my "go to" for all of my overseas travel!
Excellent  information & planning gift.
Good basic information before we go in September.
Rick does a commendable job walking through various towns and things to see. Still relevant in 2015.
Great!
I love these, and my 6 and 9 year-old Grandchildren do, as well.  What a great way to show them the world!!  Thanks, Grandma
Great flick!
Love Rick Steves
Awesome. Great info.. beautiful commentaries.. worth watching to learn a little more about traveling to Ireland.
As expected, any review from Rick Steves is worth your money.

I generally like Rick Steves, but he covers only the major tourist destinations.  There are many interesting places that he does not show or seem to know about: in Belfast, there is most bombed hotel in the world; there is an Ulster America Folk Park in County Tyrone that is fascinating.  In Scotland, he could have shown remnants of Roman Roads, Norman churches, and St. Andrews.

This CD lives up the to usual quality, and content you expect from Rick Steves.  BUT - it did not play in my dvd player.  Luckily it did play on my computer or I would have been very unhappy.  They need to monitor the QC a bit more and be sure of the maximum compatibility or give a big warning in the purchase process regarding the DVD format they are and are NOT compatible with.
My husband and I went to Ireland & Scotland a year ago and thought that they were beautiful.  We want to go back!  Part of my ancestry is Irish and Scottish.
Rick Steves is so good at this that I enjoy all of his series. I am not able to travel any longer but Rick helps me to remember where I have been and the changes since I have been at certain lands.
This was the one and only guide we took to our 10-day driving trip to Ireland and it more than covered everything we needed to know.

I have thoroughly enjoyed this series.  I used Rick's books for 2 trips to Italy and was able to plan everything without the use of a tour guide. (Rick's material was the guide)  I am now using these videos to research a trip to Ireland and have already benefited.  Anyone wanting to travel overseas should definitely check out the available resources from Rick Steves.
Rick Steves is an engaging host. I would sometimes like a little more detail but he presents well in a warm and engaging way
It didn't show enough detail of the countries.  Hardly anything on the Highlands.  Steve's travelogues don't spend enough time on any one area.
I was in Northern Ireland in March and this little film was a great little trip back!  Love their accent and loved Northern Ireland!
Great video...Be sure to pick this one up if you are planning to travel to Ireland or Scotland!
Excellent travel information which I have enjoyed very much!
Great price and good to use as preview if going on a trip.
Great video, however it is very noisy (unbalanced) can't hear the sound
Great viewing!
Rick Steves always a great way to go with travel.
Mom always wanted to go to Ireland. Now she visits from her recliner.
Very good
Great! I love the family shots
Lovely episode about the Dingle peninsula. Rick has an easy-going charming delivery, and very respectful of a country's culture and beliefs, especially in the Ulster tour.
Very informative on the 2 countries
